name: tantalizingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes you feel excited and hope that you might get or do something, especially when this does not in fact happen: They came tantalizingly close to winning. Cooking smells wafted tantalizingly in the air. See
tantalizing
More examplesFewer examplesThe disappointment wouldn't weigh so heavily if the promise of victory hadn't swirled so tantalizingly close.Opening my eyes, I found his face just above my own, his lips so tantalizingly near I could have kissed him with the barest of efforts.But the play tantalizingly offers more than it gives. The resulting dishes are tantalizingly familiar yet enticingly exotic.
